list_definition.definition: a written report of facts, events etc

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: I wish to keep a record of everything that is said at this meeting.

list_definition.definition: a round flat piece of (usually black) plastic on which music etc is recorded

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: a record of Beethoven’s Sixth Symphony.

list_definition.definition: (in races, games, or almost any activity) the best performance so far; something which has never yet been beaten

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: He holds the record for the 1,000 metres
The record for the high jump was broken/beaten this afternoon
He claimed to have eaten fifty sausages in a minute and asked if this was a record

list_definition.definition: the collected facts from the past of a person, institution etc

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: This school has a very poor record of success in exams

list_definition.definition: to write a description of (an event, facts etc) so that they can be read in the future

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: The decisions will be recorded in the minutes of the meeting.

list_definition.definition: to put (the sound of music, speech etc) on a record or tape so that it can be listened to in the future

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: Don’t make any noise when I’m recording.

list_definition.definition: (of a dial, instrument etc) to show (a figure etc) as a reading
to give or show, especially in writing

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: They record their votes in an election at the nearest polling station.

list_ex_of_english: Bertillonage was purely a system for linking suspects with their criminal records; it had no forensic application.
Many doctors who worked in the relevant period must be available for questioning and hospital records have survived.
After a short pause the two stimuli were given in reversed positions, again 25 choices were recorded and correct choices rewarded.
Looking time is recorded, and longer looking at the novel stimulus permits the inference that the infant has discriminated the two emotions.
For the validation, complete medical records were requested for each patient from the participating hospitals for the 12-week study period.
It should be noted, however, that protozoan and myxozoan parasites were not recorded in most studies.
The purpose is to record things which have been important in the past, those still possible, as well as current activities.
Rigorous comparisons among the various studies are difficult, given the diversity of areas, stimuli, behavioral task and recording paradigms involved.
